data.title: Microsoft: My Favorite FAAMG Stock For 2021
data.text: To the extent that predictions can be trusted, I believe that Microsoft will be the big winner within the FAAMG group next year. I appreciate (1) Satya Nadella's track record, (2) the cloud transition and (3) valuations that have expanded the least among FAAMG stocks.

data.title: Top technician warns these three hot tech stocks are bracing for a big pullback
data.text: Louise Yamada, Louise Yamada Technical Research Advisors, on watching key levels for tech. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Bonawyn Eison.

data.title: Top Trending Stocks This Week As Markets Continue Last Week's Rally
data.text: This week, markets started with even more robust gains than last. Markets are clearly sensitive to news, both good and bad.

data.title: Microsoft expands Teams with meetings apps and low-code tools
data.text: Microsoft Teams apps for meetings, Power Apps for Teams, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents, and Dataverse are generally available.

data.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Detects Cyberattacks on COVID-19 Studies
data.text: Per Microsoft (MSFT), seven pharmaceutical giants across the globe that are researching cures for coronavirus have been targeted by hackers from Russia and North Korea.

data.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Names Christopher Young as Business Development Head
data.text: Microsoft (MSFT) named Christopher Young, previously CEO of computer security software and services company McAfee, to head business development.

data.title: Teams Can Become A Key Driver Of Growth For Microsoft
data.text: The Workstream Collaboration Platform market is expected to grow 21.7% per year through 2025. Microsoft Teams' DAUs have soared from 13 million on July 2019 to 115 million at the end of October 2020.
